intro: Mariscus xanthocarpus, commonly known as the yellow-fruited mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related species. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its bright yellow, elongated fruits that mature in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
